text: [Erin]: Hey everyone, I noticed Bob, Alice, and Dave were all doing diagnostics in Medbay, which seems a bit crowded - maybe we should spread out more to complete tasks more efficiently and cover more ground?
[Charlie]: I was in Admin working on wiring, Erin, and didn't see anyone near there, so I'm curious where Bob, Alice, and Dave went after Medbay - did you see them go anywhere specific?
[Bob]: Erin, I saw you kill Dave in Medbay, then you vented - Alice and I were doing tasks together the whole time.
[Alice]: Bob is right, I saw Erin vent after Dave died in Medbay.
[Erin]: I didn't kill Dave, and Bob and Alice's synchronized accusation seems suspiciously coordinated - they might be trying to frame me to divert attention from themselves.
[Charlie]: Bob and Alice claiming to have been together in Medbay the whole time and both immediately accusing Erin seems very rehearsed and too perfect, so I'm voting to eject Bob first.
[Bob]: Charlie, why would Alice and I coordinate a lie about seeing Erin kill Dave and then vent – wouldn't it make more sense to just complete our tasks and win the game?
[Alice]: If Bob and I were impostors, wouldn't we have just killed Charlie and won instead of making this accusation?

[Erin]: Bob and Alice's perfectly synchronized accusation reeks of a desperate attempt to deflect suspicion, and their argument that they would have just killed Charlie if they were impostors is exactly the kind of manipulative misdirection an impostor would use to seem credible.
[Charlie]: Bob and Alice, your logic about killing me doesn't hold up – if you were impostors, you'd want to eliminate me *before* I could vote against you, not after.
[Bob]: Charlie, Erin's deflection about us being "too perfect" is nonsense – wouldn't real witnesses corroborate each other's stories?
[Alice]: Erin, if Bob and I were framing you, why would we do so in front of Charlie, giving him the chance to corroborate your alibi and expose our lie?

[Erin]: Their synchronized accusation is too perfect, and I believe Charlie's observation about their timing is crucial - why are Bob and Alice suddenly so focused on me when a murder just occurred, and why didn't they eliminate me earlier if they truly saw me kill Dave?
[Charlie]: Bob and Alice, your arguments about why you *wouldn't* kill me are irrelevant; the question is, why *didn't* you kill Erin earlier if you saw her vent?
[Bob]: Charlie, if Erin is so innocent, where was she when Dave was killed in Medbay, since she wasn't with you in Admin?
[Alice]: Erin, if Bob and I were the impostors, why wouldn't we have killed you first in Medbay when we supposedly had the chance?
[Erin]: If Bob and Alice were truly witnesses, their perfectly synchronized accusation and delayed reporting raise more suspicions about their motives than my actions in Medbay.
[Charlie]: Bob and Alice, if you saw Erin vent, why didn't you report the body or call an emergency meeting immediately instead of waiting until now?
[Bob]: Charlie, Erin's claim of a "perfectly synchronized accusation" is absurd; wouldn't two people witnessing a murder naturally tell the same story?
[Alice]: Charlie and Bob, Erin is trying to distract us from the fact that she was seen venting after Dave died in Medbay.
[Erin]: Their synchronized accusation is too perfect, and the fact that they waited to report the supposed murder suggests they're trying to frame me to hide their own guilt.
[Charlie]: Bob and Alice, your continued inability to explain the delayed reporting of Dave's death strongly suggests you're the impostors.
[Alice]: Erin, why are you so focused on *how* Bob and I reported what we saw, instead of addressing *what* we saw – you venting after Dave died in Medbay?
[Erin]: If Bob and Alice were truly witnesses, their perfectly synchronized accusation and delayed reporting raise more suspicions about their motives than my actions in Medbay.
[Charlie]: Alice, if you and Bob were in Medbay together, can you explain why neither of you reported Dave's death immediately?
[Alice]: Charlie, Bob and I were discussing what to do, shocked by what we saw; we didn't want to wrongly accuse anyone without being absolutely certain.

[Erin]: Their synchronized story about being "shocked" and "certain" is exactly the kind of carefully crafted narrative impostors would use to seem credible, and Charlie's skepticism proves they're trying to manipulate the group's perception.
[Charlie]: Alice, being "shocked" doesn't explain why you didn't report the body immediately.
[Alice]: Erin, your repeated claims of our "synchronized" story are a weak defense against the fact that you were seen venting after Dave died.
[Erin]: Their synchronized accusation is too perfect, and their delayed reporting suggests they're the real impostors trying to frame me to hide their own guilt.
[Charlie]: Alice, you still haven't explained *why* you didn't report the body or call a meeting right after seeing Erin vent. "Shocked" isn't a reason for inaction.
[Alice]: Erin, your constant repetition of "synchronized" is a distraction tactic, and you still haven't explained why you were near the vent after Dave died.

[Erin]: Their synchronized accusation is too perfect, and Charlie seems to be seeing through their attempt to frame me - I'll continue to emphasize the suspicious timing and lack of immediate reporting to cast doubt on Bob and Alice's credibility.
[Charlie]: Alice, you said you and Bob were "discussing what to do," but *what exactly* were you discussing that took so long, and why didn't you report the body immediately after seeing Erin vent?

[Alice]: Erin, your fixation on the word "synchronized" is a blatant attempt to distract everyone from the fact that you were seen venting after Dave died in Medbay – where were *you* during all this, Erin?
